intro: Reseda germanicopolitana, commonly known as the Germanicopolitan mallow, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in summer, and its leaves are broad and slightly hairy. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in herbal medicine, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
